channel.title: [PI] Writing to a players character-file?
channel.description:
Ok, so I just added a voting system, however I've modified it a little bit, so that once you've voted and you log out and back in, an interface appears (If you've voted). (Which is currently linked up to my old voting system).
So the interface only appears when I change the character-file manually. from: (vote = 0) to (vote = 1).
If I do it manually, it works fine, however, my new voting system doesn't use character files to write to in order to grab the information, it uses phpmyadmin and MySQL.
I was wondering if there's any way to make it write to the character file (as well as) writing to the PhpMyAdmin table?
Not sure what code I need to post on here, so will post upon request.. As I don't want to end up filling the thread up with random code that is of no use to anyone :/
Thanks in advance!

item.title: [PI] Writing to a players character-file?
item.dc:creator: @Kayceee Kayceee
item.description:
@Kayceee wrote:

Thanks, I’ll check it out, and it works using the old oting system, however the old system is no longer linked to anything, and therefore nothing ‘writes’ to the players character-file, meaning I had to do it manually, which made it work

So just need to link it to the new system, simply by making the new system write to character-files.

Many thanks yet again

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Writing to a players character-file?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

You can use my tutorial for this. Assuming you’ve correctly integrated, you shouldn’t be having this problem because of MySQL.

Read full topic
